report:
**Damage Report:**

**Vehicle:** [Insert Vehicle Make, Model, and Year]

**Location of Damage:** Rear Quarter Panel

**Type of Damage:** Scratches and dents.

**Description:**
The rear quarter panel of the vehicle shows signs of scratches and dents. The damage appears to be superficial but noticeable upon close inspection. The paint on the panel has been disturbed, indicating that the surface has been impacted by an external force.

**Additional Notes:**
- The damage seems to have occurred recently as there are no signs of rust or further deterioration.
- The rest of the vehicle's body appears to be in good condition with no other visible damages.

**Recommendation:**
It is recommended that the vehicle undergo a thorough inspection to determine the extent of the damage and any underlying issues such as structural damage or hidden impacts. The scratches and dents can be repaired through painting and minor bodywork if necessary.

**Signature (Insurance Adjuster):**
[Insert Name and Title]

**Date:**
[Insert Date]
